I rarely write reviews on here (or anywhere) but I feel the need to cast an objective light on this film. I watched it last night after reading all the reviews and hearing about the "horrible ending" and such. I also am admittedly not a fan of "found footage" movies as a whole, but I'll give anything a try before casting stones. With that said, many people have proclaimed this to be "the worst movie ever made" and other undeserved things. In reality, there are far worse films out there. Thousands of them. In fact, I have more respect for what these folks did with a minimal budget than I do most "blockbuster" offerings from Hollywood and other cinematic hubs around the world. However, the film does fall short as the story unravels. The movie starts off very promising. There is some respectable character development going into the film. The multiple cameras used and editing are good too. I felt a genuine sense of compassion for both Isabella and her mother, as well as for the priests. Where the film fell short with me was in how it breaks apart towards the end of the second act. I won't offer details, but what people have said about the story crumbling and the ending leaving people let down is mostly valid. However, there is much to be appreciated in the efforts behind this movie. It certainly isn't a total waste. In fact, I felt it was better executed than "The Last Exorcism" and other genre pieces. I do wish that they had offered us a real ending, and that they had kept the focus on the Rossi family and not dived into so many subplots and such. So, for those who are worried that this movie is a total waste - it isn't. There are some great moments in it for sure. A noble effort. At the same time, the rumors about the crumbling storyline and the "disappointing" ending are unfortunately rooted in something. That said, while I won't be adding a purchased copy to my video collection, I can't say that is wasn't worth at least one viewing.

This is not a review. This is a warning. Don't go to see this film. Just don't. It's so poor it's not even good in a 'laugh at a bad movie' way. I recently went to see this at the cinema and I'm glad someone else paid for my ticket because if I'd spent my own money seeing this abomination I'd probably be in tears by now.For a kick off it's filmed in a 'mockumentary' style, with a bouncing, swaying, often far to zoomed in camera angle. Now you may argue this style has been picked by the director to make the exorcisms more intense and frightening. Except all the exorcism scenes are filmed with fixed viewpoints. The only time the camera flails around is when the characters are talking to outline the story. Utterly pointless. And annoying. Secondly the acting is mostly dire. The main character, Isabella, isn't terribly portrayed although I never got the impression she really cared about her mother or was interested in exorcisms. Other characters were just pathetic, notably Father Ben and especially Michael the cameraman, who is utterly two-dimensional. Admittedly the acting isn't all bad, with a solid performance from Evan Helmuth (Father David) and a rather good sinister portrayal of a possession victim by Suzan Crowley (Maria Rossi), who was hampered only by the appalling lines she was given, which we will get to now.Finally, and worst of all, is the storyline. Words may not be able to describe this empty, pointless void of a script, filled with plot holes, laughable dialogue and embarrassing attempts at horror. Despite this, I will try.The concept of the film is that Isabella must travel to Italy to discover the facts behind the murder's her mother committed years before. She the meets renegade priests Ben and David (who smoke and swear throughout the film, I'm no expert but that seemed wrong), who are preforming exorcisms behind the Vatican's back. Then pointless filler is endured for around 40 minutes before they go to check if Isabella's mother is possessed (why not do this first, it's the point of the entire film?). The spirit then jack-knifes between characters with no real reason other than to prolong the film until you reach what will be, unless you are especially unfortunate, the worst event of your life. The ending of The Devil Inside. I won't ruin the horrific beauty of it here, but suffice to say, I laughed out loud. People in my cinema booed. And 10 seconds before the end I literally turned to the person next to me and said "If this film ends now it will be the worst movie I've ever seen". The credits then Rolled. In my humble opinion the writer of this cesspool of cinematographic vomit (William Brent Bell) should receive a lifetime ban from pen and paper, word processing software and anything sharp that he could use to carve words into things, for the good of the species as a whole. Please William for the sake of us all, never write anything again. Ever. Please .

reviews.review_title: How was this not straight to DVD??!!
reviews.content: This is the worst horror film I have EVER seen and I have seen a lot!!! It was poorly written and the acting was awful!!! You didn't care about any of the characters and the clichés were ridiculous (everyone being annoyed at the cameraman-shock) The mocumentary film does not work if your script is poor!! If you want to watch a good horror mocumentary watch Rec!! This was such a poor storyline, it was boring, inconsistent and had very few scares. It didn't fully develop any story and quite frankly I didn't care after a while I just wanted it to end...... And end it did...BADLY!!!! Don't write a horror film if by the end you're so lost in your own web of confusion that you cant come up with a conclusion! The writers even seemed to have forgotten what the point was by the end of it.Don't waste your time on this, watch something good!!!

Just saw this movie on cable and I found it very predictable and loaded with many clichés from both demonic possession films and found footage films. It's just not surprising or scary anymore. It also has many goofs and loose ends. (But hey, it's found footage, you can't expect found footage to give you all the answers...) Average performances and the typical plot. So, I guess I enjoyed it because my expectations weren't high considering how predictable this kind of movie has become lately. What makes me sad is that most of the keyboard critics rate it the lowest possible because of the ending. Why? Is the movie so predictable that you all need it to end the same way? Would it be better if the daughter freed her mother, maybe dying in the process, leaving at least one character to have a happy ending? the priest sacrificing his life to save the rest? the cameraman, as dumb as he looks, being butchered by a horde of "transparenting" demons? I think the ending is one of the things that may differentiate this movie from others. It's abrupt, inconclusive, violent. Not that I believe this could happen for real, but isn't it a very likely outcome if we imagine a situation like that happening in real life? If you don't agree then you must be clear that you want realistic, found footage movies to have Hollywood style, highly predictable endings.

i enjoyed this film for all the wrong reasons the acting was dire,they could of turned it in to a spoof and it would of still been unfunny its that bad, the only bit that made me jump is when a dog unexpectedly jumps from nowhere barking. when the so called exorcists where mumbling there prayers during the exorcism i was waiting for the possessed girl to shout LICK MY LOVE PUMP!they never did explain why the mother was sent to italy after she murdered the three wise men, if you never seen spinal tap please watch it as you will then see the quality of acting that was so badly lacking in this joke.there is only one exorcist and that movie will never be bettered, damian karras must be spinning in his grave!

reviews.review_title: There are some movie snobs around here...
reviews.content: 1. I have not seen every single exorcism movie in the world. 2. I am not an exorcist.I don't understand why all these exorcism "experts" who've seen a million exorcism movies have an issue with this movie. They keep saying its cliché and not original. How original can you really make the idea of possession without making it something completely new? Demon possession has been made entertainment for DECADES even before movies were made about it. In verbal stories possession has been immortalized before now. Human possessed, talking crap, contorting. That's what its about, if you don't want to see that or feel that's not good enough, then why are you watching yet another exorcism movie? Something that is what it is, is what it is... For instance, if I made a movie about my dog licking his own privates, wouldn't that be the same movie as your dogs? Sure the angle might be different but licking is basically licking.SOOOOOOOO in defense of this movie, I have seen a few exorcism movies and this one was different to me. Very different. It got so interesting to see the others go through their changes after being possessed and I thought it said something about the mothers possession as well. That gradual change would have been interesting to see before she murdered everyone, but that was left out. The characters changed slowly, some faster than others, but it was shocking to me sometimes to see how they were behaving. My mouth was open at times without my prior knowledge, and in shock.I did not like how fast the movie ended after they were possessed though. I wanted to see more and I was curious about the priest who did not seem possessed, because there were four demons in the mother. Either one stuck with the mother or, this particular priest was possessed and just evolving more slowly than the others.And as far as the ending goes... It seems to me like these exorcism "experts" are just mad because they didn't get a definite happy (possession free) (or sad (everyone dies) for that matter) ending. You were left wondering and in some cases that pisses me off, but this was almost perfect. To me it shows how truly mysterious demonic possession is! It shines a light on "weird incidents". Like have you ever seen a news story and wonder, "Why weren't they..." or "how could they..." I'm sure when the authorities showed up to that accident scene they were confused as heck, just like we are sometimes in life. Confused about peoples behavior.All and all, I would recommend this movie. It's not a jump out of your seat kind of movie but I found it very interesting and it caused me to think and reflect a lot! There was not a dull moment for me.And as a side note, reviewers, stop trying to put things in a box while also expecting them to be creative. You say this was cliché by comparing it to other movies and neglect to see the things about it that are truly unique.

reviews.review_title: A compelling horror movie marred by the final two minutes
reviews.content: I love horror movies, especially supernatural thrillers. I also love found footage movies (the good ones, at least), so when I heard about this movie, I was intrigued; the trailers alone were enough to keep me up at night. Finally on opening weekend, I sat down in a crowded theater hoping to be treated to a memorable, horrifying experience. Sadly, when I left the theater, I felt robbed of the 7 or so dollars I paid to see this, which is a shame because it actually was a good movie, up until the ending which ruined all of it. Let's start from the beginning, shall we? The movie opens with police footage of a multiple-murder scene, which leads to them discovering the culprit: a woman who appears to be almost feral and saying odd things. This is Maria Rossi, the vessel the supposed demons have possessed. Fast forward a little bit and her daughter, Isabella, travels to Maria's mental asylum in Italy to prove that her mother's actions were the act of demons and not insanity, which is the authorities' belief. To do this, she enlists the help of a trio of unconventional exorcists and together they learn that the force they're up against may be more than any of them can handle. What I like about this movie is that its possessions are very realistic in that they don't rely on levitation, projectile vomiting, or any other of the usual exorcism movie parlor-tricks, thereby allowing you to question whether the individuals are really possessed or simply insane. The movie also has a hyper-realistic feel in that it is shot not only in found-footage, but almost exactly like a documentary, adding to the chills. To be able to illicit such scares with so little actually shown definitely takes talent.Sadly, such talent is wasted due to a few problems. One is the obvious glaring plot hole of why an American mental patient who's committed murder is being sent to a mental asylum all the way in Italy, but I suppose you could suspend your disbelief of that long enough to get through the movie. The second problem is not so forgivable: the ending. Oh man, the ending completely destroys all the good things this movie had going for it. Now, I understand that most found-footage movies do tend to lose their way towards the end, but "The Devil Inside" really did it. Without giving too much away, I'll just say that the ending was abrupt and anticlimactic. It was almost like the movie was building up to a climax, but then just...bam, the end. Right at the end of the second act. I felt ripped off, the friends I went with felt ripped off, the whole theater started calling out "that's it?" and "seriously?". I only hope that there is a "Devil Inside 2", if nothing else to finish this story properly! It was actually good starting out, but that ending just destroyed the entire movie and left it feeling incomplete. Such a shame.

When will *Hollywood* start to realise that camcorder style movies.......SUCK!!!!! Everything post Blairwitch has fallen by the waste side really. We all get our hopes up every time and then have them dashed!! Paranormal activity, Troll Hunter, Cloverfield and now this...it just ain't working folks. Not only do we have a home footage style movie that gives you the usual nauseous feelings but the whole concept of exorcism has been done 10 times over. Again, anything that's post Excorist really doesn't measure up, but this particular movie fails on both levels.Early trailers looked tasty (as they usually do LOL) but come the final product, I was bitterly let down. Over acted to the point where you wonder if they're even going off a script. In trying to make it genuine real footage, discovered by the cops blah blah blah you just start to get annoyed because you know fine well it's all bullsh*t.My advice, stick on the Exorcist again or even the original Nightmare on Elm Street if you want a couple of cheap, silly scares!!!

reviews.review_title: Was expecting more from this film.
reviews.content: first of all this movie wasn't that good due to the ending the how the plot what i have seen is that the plot changed to one person to the other and basically it was about the girls mother. but i didn't like all that religious talking about the spirits and that stuff because it felt like documentary and history. I wanted to all refer to a movie movie plot not give reports and stuff about people being possessed. what makes it scary is that anyone can be prey for the devil to take control of. their are evil spirits of all kinds. a spirit can movie from one to the other like that simple. I felt pretty creeped at points and it is a bit scary because this is real in real life and it relates to people who been in these situations. the ending sucked and creeped me out a lot cause the evil spirits caused their death to all innocent souls. and this shows what an evil spirit of Satan is. I hope they make a second movie hopefully to be better than this. overall i give it a low 6/10 rating due to bad ending and short film it felt like 30 min watching this.

reviews.review_title: Devil Inside. Rip Off-Run Away doesn't live up to the Hype
reviews.content: The movie, if u want to call it that, ends, and the credits come up, and the entire audience looks at each other, many of whom still have popcorn left, and say out loud 'that's it??????' They finish take a handful of popcorn, slurp down their sodas and grumble their way out of the theater, feeling heavily cheated by the movie Mongols once again. Was the movie even 80 minutes without credits, not sure, but this one gets the big WTF! Ouch, I feel violated on the way to my car, and the group of us, because yes siree bob, we all bought into the hype. We caught a spanking on this one, and what's it made so far, 40 or so million buck-a-roonies. The clever thing it was mostly first week, before word got around just how bad it was. But what made it so un-satisfying I can't quite put my finger on. It started off 'real' or at least felt it, but maybe some of it was forced, the guy who played the director in the movie, kept on taking me out of the movie, he was the worst. The heavy set priest wasn't bad, but he did lose me once during the movie, like he was pushing a little, definitely missed one or two of his moments, but overall he wasn't bad, not an easy role, and the skinnier priest, main girl and mother did their jobs, in the end I felt the director character was painful to watch and everyone else good to really good. Was that guy the director of the movie and he put himself in the movie? Just the same, what was the problem, why was everyone in the theater so let down when the end credits popped up? Why the so many "That's it?" rumbles. Is it that the third act just became poop and ended without proper resolve, or really any at all. Not sure, but left the theater very unsatisfied and there was a lot of good scary elements, and not bad acting, what happened. I guess overall, the movie just missed. I wouldn't recommend this one at all.

reviews.review_title: Not As Bad As Some Say
reviews.content: I've read reviews here that indicate this movie is the worst Horror movie of all time, I can only imagine these reviews come from people who don't watch a lot of horror films.While this is only an average film, it does have certain positive aspects that will keep you entertained for its short run time. Dealing with demonic possession, the film offers some scary moments but ultimately fails to deliver much context or sustained interest.I agree the acting was extremely bad from the majority of the cast, however the mockumentary style works well for the jumps that are present and gives it a reason to be put in front of an audience.If you're looking for a few cheap scares then this is for you, if you're looking for a horror film filled with mythology, acting and dialogue, then I'd look somewhere else.

reviews.review_title: I want an hour and 30 minutes of my life back!!!!
reviews.content: OK, I just saw The Devil Inside. If you want to know how it was. It was a cross between The Exorcist, The Last Exorcism, and Blare Witch Project with NO ending at all. A ton of s**t that you've already seen a million times before. The camera work was violently shaking the whole time. The shaking only stopped about three times for about one minute each time when they looked into the camera making a fake diary statement. It was bull***t. "Phoney acting." No one acts like that. I've seen better acting on the sh****est soap opera ever. I want 1hr 30 minutes of my life back, and my MONEY too! If there is a movie that will be playing over, and over, and over in HELL!! Well, This is it. I'd rather sit through Battlefield Earth, or Lawnmower Man 2 1000 times over..

reviews.review_title: The Devil Is In The Details and Its Point of View
reviews.content: The Devil Inside looked promising. A young woman goes to Italy to investigate why her mother supposedly killed three people (2 priests and a nun) twenty years ago. Was she possessed or did she go bonkers for another reason? The premise seemed interesting enough and with the creepy face of the nun on the cover of the DVD I thought why not give it a chance.I always like horror movies that investigate some history and bring it to the current or future date. Have also been a fan of possession movies since The Excorsist. This one however had me scratching my head once I realized that it was shot as a documentary style. I understand the affect the directors are trying to make getting you to live the story more closely. My biggest problem when watching this POV style is, I always find myself asking who is watching the video in order for us to be watching it now. Starting off with the murders supposedly committed by the mother, shown in Police Video files, to the daughter's documentary style investigating her mothers possession, I kept wondering at times, when was this filmed and who found it. And if this is a documentary by the daughter why was she doing it? Was she a film maker, art student, internet blogger, I could not remember why she was filming it. Why at this point of her life did she feel was the right time to investigate it? Just too many questions for me to totally be engrossed in the movie. If you want to engage the audience the back story needs to be clear, such as the Blair Witch movie.Overall it did have some scares and the special effects kept me interested in watching. Otherwise it could have been a whole lot better.3 out of 10.

Personally, I think the movie was okay, however, the shaking camera made most of us sick and headache. Is this a new style of filming? Is this kind of filming so good that you have to shake the camera all the time? I didn't get it. The story was poor, not anyhow creativity, old tricks. And I personally think the movie makers had a bad attitude on making films, stopped the movie right in the middle that me and my friends felt like being fooled to watch this movie, and also pay for the next one... Yeah, I am a hater of this movie, and neither do I gonna pay for the 2nd one anyway...I understood the ending of this movie as "You were tricked, ha-ha, come here and pay us to see whats going on..." I won't.

I went with 4 people. When we got out of the movie, all 4 of us felt really sick. I am not talking about "Oh wow that was really graphic and disgusting" like most scary movies because it is not at all....I'm talking motion sickness from the camera jumping around all over the place. Two out of the four had to leave the theater for a while. I also noticed several people around me get up and leave the theater. When I walked out at the end of the movie, someone had thrown up all over the ground outside the theater.In terms of plot, it was nothing special. If you are looking for something scary, it wasn't scary at all (and that is saying a lot because I am a wimp who covers my eyes).Don't waste your time or money. It's not worth the motion sickness.

I won't go into the details of plot or storyline, just in case you want to see this piece of cinema garbage.Basically, if you saw the trailers you saw the best parts of the movie. They use what I call "cheap shots" to get jumps from the audience. The movie starts out alright, seems to be getting you into the vibe. Then it stalls. A few more jumps, and all of a sudden, it starts to get good. Really good. Then, at the best part, the part you've been waiting for, it ends.I actually said in a voice loud enough to be heard by the rest of the rest of the audience, (quoting Brian Griffin from "Family Guy" Season 3, Episode 1) "It's over, a lot of people in the audience look p*ssed."I am sorry to have seen this movie. It wasted an hour and fifteen minutes of my life. They say the movie is one hour and 27 minutes long, well all I can say is I sat down at 3:15pm, and the credits were rolling by 4:45. Take out the time for previews and other commercials, and your actual movie viewing time is around 75 minutes.I am glad I saw it at the matinée time for only $5. Had I paid the prime time viewing price of $9.50, I would have demanded a refund.What a disappointment.To leave on a positive note, because the movie was so short, my friend and I had the opportunity to see a different movie and still get the matinée rate, so score on that one at least.

reviews.review_title: Cloverfield was a box-office Smash compared to This Garbage!
reviews.content: Forget EVERY good review you've read here...this movie just flat out STUNK! I made the mistake (thougt it was calculated) of reading the first 10 reviews here on IMDb - they were all RAVE REVIEWS! I dragged my poor wife with me since I felt that I was armed with the ratings knowledge of the ages...I was instead met with embarrassment & disappointment! If you're a full-fledged member of the trendy-crowd - then maybe this crap is for you, but the majority of folks in the theater who saw this film with me were not only upset...but by the end of the movie...were rather angry that we wasted $10.00+ and our time!! I really tried to like this film...it could have been good - but unfortunately for us...it was not! The longer we sat there...just waiting for some kind of plot to emerge and maybe some action that was scary and not humorous...the more my backside started to hurt! It just did not happen! Don't be fooled...check ALL of the ratings - not just the ones on top!

I personally really enjoyed this movie however I am a big fan of horror movies and especially these types of documentary or found footage. Though there are more bad ones than good ones out there, for some reason I still enjoy watching them. So anyway that's a personal preference and I agree with other people in that you will either like it or hate it. I did find it kind of slow to get going but once it did I enjoyed it and didn't get bored. For me it really was easy to feel with the characters and fall into the realism. Of course there are parts that are clearly fake and ridiculous like in any horror movie. Putting that aside I felt the fear, tension, and uncomfortable moments. While its not the best out there, to me personally, its a good one and worth a try if you are a fan of these types of movies.

Overall the storyline and content of this movie was very good, even with the abrupt ending. Some parts of the movie could have been expanded and helped to create a terrifying horror film. The main problem that I have is with the way that it was filmed. I do realize that it was in the form of a documentary therefore the third person camera view. However that doesn't mean that the camera should be constantly out of focus and bouncing around. (was the cameraman supposed to be very bad at his job? ). I found trying to watch this movie in the theatre very difficult due to the camera work. I don't know if anyone involved with the movie might read this, but if you are please stop with the constant camera shaking. In well timed situations to get the mood, no problem. But not the entire movie, it's just nauseating. Other than that as I said in the beginning it was a pretty good film. I'd give it 7/10. If I could have looked at the screen the whole time but will drop it to 5/10 because of the camera shake. (cloverfield reminiscent).

reviews.review_title: The Devil Inside~ Unfufilling with such potential!
reviews.content: I felt the movie had the ingredients to be a great horror movie, but there were elements that were missing which made the ending to the movie premature and not complete.It was as if the ending was the climax to the movie and it just ended before there was any kind of explanation, epilogue or something. With all the hype, I thought it could have been better, like demons lurking or EVP from the tapes. It was still unclear for the fate of those exorcised, or anyone.It was hard seeing this as a documentary/movie due to the actors looking coached or to rehearsed. After the ending, I heard boos and even said, "That's it?" After watching it, I wish I would have spent my $$ on something else. I would have added another star but I left the theater feeling unfulfilled by this cinematic experience.

This was one of the worse movies I have ever seen. The commercials showed the only "good" parts and they weren't even good. Save your time and your money. I would say wait for the DVD but it's not even worth the $ to rent. After the movie, our group was wondering why we didn't just leave and I can say no one leaving that movie had a good thing to say about it. So your waiting and you think okay something good is finally going to happen, you will be waiting for nothing! If you like these kinds of movies, skip it, you will be very disappointed. I realize that the trailers they show for movies can reflect something a little different but the trailer for this movie was so deceptive. In a nutshell I hated this movie, hated wasting my time and money and based on other reviews I've read, pretty much everyone who sees this movie has the same opinion in the end :(

I don't understand why the reviews are so low on this movie. This movie is genuinely scary(and I'm hard to scare). The feel is very creepy. The possessions themselves are some of the scariest I have ever seen.

reviews.review_title: Terrible and practically uneventful, but enjoyable.
reviews.content: I went to see this film last night and I have already made a quick decision about it. This film is terrible, it's far from the worst film I've ever watched, as despite all its problems, it was quite enjoyable.There were many inconsistencies and quite a few flaws in both acting and dialogue. The swearing from the possessed was incredibly comical and the way one of the characters crawled up the walls simply made this film like a rip-off of The Exorcist. It seemed more like a horror film by Friedberg & Seltzer turned serious, along with the cinematography of the Blair Witch Project. Also, for a movie supposedly designed to be as if it actually happened - the script seemed very rehearsed especially at parts during exorcism scenes. The ending was probably the worst part, you could see what the director was trying to achieve: confusion in the audience as to what will happen next, a seriously poor cliffhanger. In todays society, you can't simply just finish movies like that, it was uneventful (like most of the film). If they are making a sequel, I most certainly will not be seeing it.Yet despite my overall dislike of the film, I didn't walk out. I suppose I didn't want to feel like I wasted money on a ticket.

reviews.review_title: Read all the bad reviews, then go see the movie
reviews.content: I kept in mind all of the negative reviews and comments before I went to see this movie. If you are not a fan of documentaries, don't see it. It was like watching the Documentary Channel on the big screen. Yes, it is a little slow, but the exorcism scenes are SO disturbing and real- like no other movie has ever captured them, that it makes up for what the film lacks. I've read it being compared to Blair Witch.Its better than the Blair Witch-which I hated-If you're looking for blood and guts and over the top effects, this is not the movie for you. It's more of a mental mind twist that makes you think, than a horror movie. Just go in knowing that its not going to be what you expect, and get through the first quarter of the movie and I think you may enjoy it...

reviews.review_title: I wouldn't waste your money on this one.
reviews.content: I'm not sure if I am a bad person to review this movie because horror films never really seem to scare me but this one really didn't do it for me.The plot lacked during the whole movie and I felt like it was trying to be "The Exorcist" for the duration of the film. The ending was also extremely abrupt and it wasn't that good kind of 'what the hell just happened?'.In saying that, a group of girls ran out of the cinema because they were terrified so maybe it's not as bad as originally thought.I'm glad I got to see this one for free, not the best thing I've seen in terms of the horror/thriller persuasion.

reviews.review_title: An exorcism of a great genre.
reviews.content: "The Devil Inside" was an extreme disappointment as we had very high hopes as the trailer looked good, proving it to have great potential, but unfortunately the trailer shown the only good parts of the movie. The parts of the film that were enjoyed was the performance of Susan Crowley (who unfortunately was not in the movie as much as she should have been), the small segment of the movie when the priest gets possessed and kills himself, and the only scare in the movie being a random dog jumping up at a gate which the main characters are walking past. Aside from this, everything else in the movie was disappointing, especially the ending which happened abruptly. Despite the movie being incredibly short, which the credits taking up 20 minutes, the story itself appeared to drag on.Would recommend avoiding it.

reviews.review_title: The Rite idea, the wrong Exorcist
reviews.content: Just left The Devil Inside, and have to say, aside from a few clips that The Rite could have borrowed to up the interest next to Anthony Hopkins doing bad, oh so good, there is nothing worth paying for at the cinema to see this film. Wait until it comes on television, and even then, if you have something important to do with your life, don't pass it up for this hour and a half of mess.There was a great sense that there was no true writing in this film. They started shooting it, and then said to one another, "Oh yea, let's do that next, and then we can do this!" And then it seemed they ran out of ideas, so let's throw everyone upside down, and leave a cliffhanger. This left the audience confused and frustrated. I could hear the "huh?" in everyone's voices, mixed with a clap or two. I wasn't really sure how to feel until I walked out and really thought about it. And I also really wondered if I would ever sit through a sequel to hopefully give me a sense of closure. There were even some scenes that had no point in the film whatsoever. "Girl storms out of insane asylum and can't find her keys." Why? What was the point? Did Demon Mommie Dearest steal them to let herself into her apartment halfway around the world? We will never know!!! Why did the cameras black out for a moment?? Why even point it out? No answers, to which I would assume that the whole reason for the blackout was a demon passing or something of that nature, not even sure. There were far too many details that created setup after setup for a situation without any resolution, and during what would have seemed to be the rising to an actual climactic moment (in my head I was thinking, finally(!), this is getting good), it all just ends, very poorly. If this had been Die Hard, Bruce Willis would have stood up from the wreckage and cleaned the floors with the villains faces for another hour, but in this case, I guess that's all they had, so we are left with what felt like half a film. The only plus, is that I do appreciate the way that the exorcisms were portrayed, and if I'm going to see an exorcism movie, I want to see an exorcism!! I gave this film 3 stars for dumb luck; in my opinion the actual exorcism scenes were better than The Last Exorcism, The Rite, Paranormal Activity 2 (only because, we couldn't see it, only heard it), and The Exorcism of Emily Rose (because she really just screamed a lot). Kudos to the contortionist for dislocating her shoulders and really working that out.

reviews.review_title: How do you fail so hard at making a movie?
reviews.content: The trailers looked great, and I'll watch anything with an exorcism. I was hearing the reviews were bad, but I was so excited (exorcism!!) that I thought I'd see whatever redeeming value it might have and enjoy it on some level. WRONG. This is an incredible piece of trash, from the faux-documentary premise to all the lame jump scares totally unrelated to the story, to the utter failure of an ending. Absolutely pathetic. I have no idea how someone can take an intrinsically scary concept like demonic possession and somehow make it so laughable and predictable. How do movies like this get made?? Is it THAT hard to come up with an actual interesting story that isn't full of major logistical problems? Please don't waste your money on this pile of uninspired, unscary garbage.

I try not to be too harsh when I watch horror movies, because lets be real here; I'm the lazy one that's spending nine bucks a months on netflix or shamelessly borrowing my friends DVDs to get an adrenaline rush that I'm too poor and too disinclined to go and find through recreational activities like bungee jumping. Whereas I stay in my room and watch horror movies all night and never contribute to society or interact with another human being in person unless I absolutely have to, people in their hundreds come together to supply my need for adrenal exertion so that I can go online and post reviews about what they spent eight months making and I spent eighty minutes watching.That said, I'm trying to be nice with this move. I really, really am. I saw the trailers for this... erm... 'film' all over youtube back before it's release, when I was terrified of horror movies and I had to turn off my speakers AND my monitor until the ad had passed by and I could get to my actual content. Back then, I thought it was possibly the scariest movie ever!I was also still living in fear of The Blair Witch Project's VHS dust slip. All things considered I have to give this movie some points for effort-- I haven't seen too much of science and religion in horror movies, at least not on the exorcism front. Though, this movie is just riddled with tropes and the ending is absolutely terrible from all angles. Story architecture is supposed to work like a hill-- you work up to the main conflict and afterwards everything starts to calm down. However, in this story, we work up to the main conflict and instead of being able to step off the escalator it keeps going, and now you're looking down at your family and friends who have watched normal movies with normal story arcs who are on the way back down the hill and you're frantic and panicking because you're supposed to be down there-- This is not how stories work! This crazy ride was supposed to go back down!-- And all you can do is helplessly keep walking because there's no way back down now, you've already crossed over the point of no return and sealed your fate in the realm of bad storytelling.

reviews.review_title: Not exorcism of Emily rose level, but definitely up there!
reviews.content:
Isabella goes to Rome to see her mother in a hospital for the first time in years. A mother that had killed 3 people already. Isabella teams with with two exorcists and a camera man, a similar theme for these movies. Her mother is possessed but they need proof to bring to the church and proof they got. Maybe a little too much..
I definitely liked this movie. I'm a person who loves jump scares and this did a great job scaring me. Someone else said exorcism of Emily Rose was so much better and I agree, but it's hard to find a good horror movie and regardless of better movies, this was good. I was interested only a few minutes in and then it got better and better. I recommend giving this a shot.

They say this movie is inspired by real events...Well...This is just another pitiful try by the church to make people forget that many church members are just in not so orthodox situations in private. They just want to make people go to back to church and to support the church with money. The ones who really believe in God, don't need to pay the church for going.If you look at it as a critic and movie lover, the effects are well done but it looks like a low budget movie.It's good only to scare teenagers. Total waste of money.

Wow, I can't believe people actually talk bad about this movie. First of all most movies deserve at least a little respect. To say such things as "It was more funny than scary" or "This movie played off of some other movie" is rather childish. I mean I don't see your name on any director chair right? Just food for thought.I do agree, I wouldn't go see this movie in the theater, but that's my honest opinion. Since my wife gets terrified by devil movies she of course passed on this one. I watched this movie at midnight, alone, in the dark, and let me tell you I had goosebumps throughout most of the movie.Some people tend to "force" themselves or psych themselves out so they don't get too scared but I on the other hand love to do that to myself. So if you really want to get the full effect of this movie I suggest watching it at home, alone or with a select few, in the dark and I promise no disappointment.I gave this movie a 10 not because it was a "perfect" 10. 10 means excellent is the IMDb rating scale and this movie was just that.

reviews.review_title: This movie is a waste of money AND time
reviews.content: This movie stinks. It's supposed to be scary. It's not scary. It's supposed to be a story. It's not a story.The acting was okay so it's a shame these otherwise okay actors were hobbled by a predictable story line, shaky, shoddy camera work, glacial pacing that was nonetheless tiring to put up with since it didn't pay off, and the most low-budget of low-budget approaches to movie-making. Oh, yeah, it wasn't scary AT ALL.As soon as it ended I seriously felt angry at the theater (my favourite theater) for putting this on the bill. I would not show this at a theater I owned because I would feel like I was gouging my customers.

reviews.review_title: Violent, pointless film with a very lazy ending
reviews.content: After seeing the red band trailer for this film, I expected a scary, brutal exorcism film. I was hoping that they didn't show the best parts of the film in the red band trailer. But they did. For the most part, this film is very boring and nothing interesting happens. It plays out like every other found footage film of the last few years. You would expect an R rated horror film to at least be somewhat scary, but I don't remember being scared at all during the entire film. The story goes nowhere you want it to and leaves plots points unanswered. The worst though is the ending of this film. The film has one of the most abrupt, anticlimactic endings I have seen in a while. 2.5 out of 10

When I first saw a Preview for The Devil Inside I got excited. I love this type of film and really looked forward to seeing it. The reviews started coming and my hopes started dropping. When I finally curled up in the theater to watch it my disappointment was probably visible to everyone.I'm forty-five years old and have watch a lot of scary/horror/possession films in my life. The Devil Inside looked like it was simply a remake of the best moments of all the films that came before it. There was absolutely nothing original about this film including the Blair Witch camera work. What a waste of my time and money.

Only go watch this movie if you don't mind seeing a movie set in Italy but shot in Romania. The characters speak Italian with a strong Romanian accent and fly Tarom to Rome from the U.S. (which is impossible). Even the departure airport, which is supposed to be somewhere in the U.S., is clearly a Romanian airport. Throughout the movie, you can recognize iconic places and buildings in Bucharest, such as the "Ateneul Roman". What were they thinking?? Other than the total lack of attention to detail, this movie is short and dull. At the end of the movie, everyone in my row wanted their money back. You're better off renting The Last Exorcism if you want to see something more decent and original. Something similar (although not about demonic possessions but aliens) is The Fourth Kind, which was extremely well executed compared to The Devil Inside. Try to do everything in your power to resist going to see this movie; you'll never get those 83 minutes of your life back.

reviews.review_title: Awful, awful Attempt at a film, AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!
reviews.content: Please do not waste your time and hard earned money going to see this pathetic excuse for a film. This film is the epitome of marketing over content. It is disgraceful that films can sell themselves in the advertising with no shred of originality/decent acting/half decent story line or any redeeming features whatsoever in the actual film.I am really struggling to find anything, even a single positive comment to make about this film other than the fact that the ending came when I was not expecting it which was a welcome surprise (the only surprise in this film!).There is needless foul language from those possessed which felt like cheap attempts at shock value and ended up detracting from the impact of what could of been potentially quite scary scenes and resulting in an off the scale cringe-a-thon.I really really want to write more in the hope that I could potentially even stop one person from wasting their time with this garbage but I don't want to waste another minute of my life on anything to do with this "film".I actually signed up to this site just to leave a bad comment for this film, that's how ridiculously bad it is. It isn't even the type of bad film that can be appreciated for its awfulness, it's just straight forward terrible film making.There really should be marks less than 1 because this deserves a minus 4.5 (the amount of pounds I wasted on entry fee).

It is a documentary like film with a cheap budget. Much like the Paranormal Activity series it has no soundtrack. I had a hard time not making fun of it and ended up laughing during some of the more serious scenes. If this movie hadn't been in this documentary format, it probably would have been a ton better and I might have been able to take it seriously. The first scene is really good and sets up the movie to be something great. The idea for the movie is great; the story in the movie at least has the potential to be great. As the movie progressed I gradually realized that the movie wasn't going to be great or even good. The trailer to the movie was better than the movie itself unfortunately. It basically promises more than it delivers. Do not see if you didn't like Paranormal Activity or the Blair Witch Project or movies with hand-held camera work or if you don't like god-awful movies (no pun intended).

This is the worst film I have seen at the cinemas in a long time. I am a big fan of horror films and had high expectations of this film, however I was deeply disappointed!! Rubbish plot, shaky camera didn't expect the film to be all hand-held!!! However this wasn't a big problem after loving paranormal activity and the Blair Witch Project. The trailer is the film basically, watch the trailer and you don't need to go and see the film!! The film is only 1 hour and 20 mins long, and doesn't fully get started until half way through! Most of the time it is characters talking to the camera in a documentary style! However some good bits, few jumps! Majority of people I was in cinema with laughed all the way through and booed massively at the end. Save your money, you would rather watch Beauty and the Beast!!

reviews.review_title: Looking for half decent Found Footage?
reviews.content: So yeah, a lot of us are pretty tired of found footage horror movies and yeah, the plot of The Devil Inside (2012) isn't super original. A possessed woman, Maria Rossi (played by Suzan Crowley) flips out during her exorcism, allegedly murders all those participating, is found not guilty by reason of insanity during the trial, is then locked away inside a hospital and eventually shipped off to another one in Rome. (All of which we learn in basically the first 3 minutes of the movie) Cut to sometime latter, when the now adult daughter of this woman, Isabella (Fernanda Andrade), decides to make a documentary about her mother and travels to Italy, to interview her and visit an exorcism school, where she meets two priests who engage in extra curricular activities that may or may not involve unauthorized exorcisms, since at this school, they apparently frown on that sort of thing, surprisingly.As expected with this type of movie, creepy stuff is caught on film. What is ultimately important about this type of movie to us, is whether or not that creepy stuff works. Does it work? For the most part, yes it actually does. Quite well at times.PROSA pretty ballsy, if somewhat expected ending.Effective opening scene walk through of the aftermath of Maria's failed exorcism. Looks and feels like you are going through a real crime scene.Contortionists rule!While I've never had a problem with shaky cam, ever, I don't think those who do will have a problem with this movie.CONSThat ballsy ending is definitely not for everyone and has turned off a great deal of viewers.FINAL SCOREI think we can all agree that the "Found Footage" sub-genre has pretty much worn out it's welcome in 2013, but for all we know, after the dust settles 10-15 years from now, maybe we might be inclined to give this style of cinema a second chance. And I think in that time, when looking back, The Devil Inside (2012) might be considered one of the better found footage movies. As long as they don't make a bunch of sequels ruining the original. Don't get me wrong, The Devil Inside is not great a movie, but if you don't mind watching another found footage movie (I don't blame anyone who does), I do think The Devil Inside is a good movie.6/10 stars

So we decided to go watch this movie at the theater. I pretty much don't remember much about it except i kept falling asleep and everyone kept waking me up because we spent 2 dollars to see it. Anyways what i DID see, it was not all that interesting, didn't keep my attention too well, and well, BORING. Well since i have to add stuff to fill all this empty space in the text i will just say again, boring, CAN make you fall asleep, and not worth the time. You'll have MUCH more fun at work than you would watching this movie pretty much, just rambling on because i have to add and add until i have 10 lines worth of text. so yeah, don't bother with this film.

reviews.review_title: Flat plot, high potential, low result.
reviews.content: The average vote is correct for such a movie. First: I live in Italy, and more or less all the spoken Italian in the movie is awful, it sucks and this that makes the movie really fake to me, considering it's supposed to be filmed in Italy. I think this detail is a big mistake for a movie that claims to be a documentary-like movie. I know it probably doesn't make any difference to someone who doesn't understand a word of this language, but I couldn't feel involved for a single minute in the movie because of this. Other than that, the plot is really predictable, especially the end (but it makes sense, a predictable end for a predictable movie). If you saw "The Blair Witch Project" you can find so many similarities that you could think it's an exorcism-adaptation of that movie. Too many cheap/trash ideas (multiple possession, bible's pages, reversed crosses, great imagination!). The only reasons I would watch this movie is just for some nice exorcism scenes. But nothing more. I give a 4. A movie to watch if you have really nothing else to do.

*POSSIBLE SPOILERS!*Just watched this movie tonight. Had high hopes the first time I saw the trailer, but much lower hopes upon reading reviews. The movie starts out well enough, but gets sidetracked and feels rushed towards the end. What made The Exorcist so scary was the build-up and the atmosphere. Every scene in this movie - particularly the exorcism scenes - feels rushed. It starts to get interesting with the others becoming possessed, but they end that quickly too with the stupid ending. It's almost as if they ran out of funds and decided to end it there. I forget what the term was, but where demons jump into other peoples' bodies - this should have been explored further. They could have made it interesting with each of them becoming possessed, but nothing. It ends suddenly in a car crash. Also, why not explore the one priest's problems? The demon was taunting him about his uncle I'm assuming and how he wanted him to die, but they never explored this. I don't know. It was OK I suppose, but it really could have been a good movie had they taken their time with the story and some scenes.

This movie made me very mad . The ending especially, everything was all good until the end. it had all the right qualities a movie should have , but the ending. very disappointing . i wont say what happens whatever i say u'll want to watch it even more, so just spreading the word like the rest of us that hated this film. Poor managers from theaters will have to deal with the angry mob. good luck.i went with my girlfriends, we expected to be scared to the bone but instead we almost fell asleep. we were going to walk out but i guess we were expecting a good ending, there's scary parts. but not good enough to make you jump. I'm a number one fan of scary movies but this movie made me not want to watch one ever again. i would put a gazillion exclamation marks to express my anger but this website wont let us.

reviews.review_title: For everyone who isn't sure if they should see it or not.
reviews.content: So I've noticed that people either love it or hate it. The way the movie ends isn't really so bad as compared to when it ends, about 15 minutes after it (finally) starts picking up. Also the main character is really annoying and boring and acts in a way that would have you guess her mother went crazy yesterday, not as a young child. And lastly, a lot isn't explained too clearly, but I suppose that's a given with movies using this "found footage" gimmick. If it wasn't for these factors this movie, in opinion, would be better than paranormal activity. The haters are making it out to be way worse than it is and to compensate the people who didn't mind it are being way to generous.

reviews.review_title: YES!!! They gave me my money back
reviews.content: I'll start with this. As soon as the first end credit rolled, a woman shouted. "Let's get our money back." Great idea. We formed a small mob and marched to the manager, where thankfully we got vouchers to see a real movie. Sorry, but micro-budget films have their limitations and a good trailer and marketing can make anything look good. Even this sad excuse for a film.Where do we start? The story. Well this had some potential and the set-up led me to believe that the movie could get good. Unfortunately, the film maker became victim to his own story telling conventions and the documentary style shaky camera began to hinder the story. He became trapped in trying to keep realism and the camera work, lighting and set-ups were so bad, they gave me a headache. The story got weighed down in docu-drama dialogue, and trying to make the documentary realism, lost all the traits of good writing. Gone were the subtext, character development and purpose to scenes which build momentum in a great story. The direction was focused on creating a pseudo-realism that kept the film flat and unemotional. The funny thing was, that in the edit, they used shots that were not from the documentary camera and no explanation of an added cameras in that scene was given. This is funny later in the film, they make blatant mention of additional cameras. The on screen title information with dates and times of the footage was distracting and not necessary for every shot in some sequences. This whole story had holes the size of boulders and unfortunately there was so much promise lost in bad filmmaking.Was it scary? Ask my wife? She gets scared at the stupidest things and can't take scary movies too well. She was terrified of the trailer and reluctant to go. But she said she would, because I wanted to see it. COORS LIGHT COLD HARD FACT: She was never scared and mostly disinterested. Only one scene made her remotely uncomfortable and her overall impression was the rest of the movie sucked so bad that one good scene wouldn't do it.The acting. Maybe this was some of the saving grace. Solid performances for a no name cast. Nothing terrible, but nothing incredible. The production value. This was the worst offender. The so called documentary film maker who was a character in this film looked like a normal competent human being. His so called camera work was so horrible that you would have thought this was an epileptic toddler holding the camera. They made no use of the beautiful visuals Rome had to offer and if this so called documentary filmmaker was real, any idiot gets b-roll and some establishing shots.The editing was clunky and unfortunately the director/editor fell victim to his own story- telling device and his attempt at pseudo-realism offered little choices in the use of sound design or score. The minimalist effects only added to a micro-budget feel that felt like a bad student film.THE WINNER!! Insurge/ Paramount bought this kiddie project for a cool mil, so you know it cost a lot less and turned it into a bread winner with a trailer and minimal marketing. WOW.. Marketing wins again.. I AM SO GLAD MY $30 WAS NOT PART OF THE PROFIT. I GOT MY MONEY BACK.. YES YES YES.

I had so many high expectations of this film and absolutely love films that are filmed in this way. However I didn't find that it met the expectations that I had.Don't get me wrong, the plot was brilliant and I think if it was filmed in any other way then it wouldn't have worked. The exorcism scenes were just brilliant ... having said that there was something missing from the film for me and I can't put my finger on it.The ending was quite perfect and I couldn't imagine it ending any other way without leaving it open for a sequel, and the last few minutes did make me sit up.I've given it 5/10.

First, its a documentary type of film. Camera is good, not the Blair witch stuff. This movie started out intense, straight to the point. Acting was good...then it just faltered toward the end. The girl just started getting annoying, and then the priests just falls a part. You would think that since they claimed to be such experts in exorcism, they would handle the situations better. More so, you start getting the feeling that you know exactly whats going to happen, and you are right! Its a good thing I didn't watch it in theaters. I heard a lot of people booed in the theaters. If only they wrote the ending to where a lot of questions got answered and not leave it as such a stupid typical ending. What a waste of production. Sad thing is...it did have so much more potential.

reviews.review_title: Worst horror film I've ever seen.
reviews.content: I saw this last night (opening weekend, Saturday night) with my girlfriend and before yesterday I never saw an audience so annoyed, confused and angry with an ending. The 3 words "what the f**k" seemed to pass from left to right, from me including. It's as if they just decided at the very last minute to cut the last 30 minutes out of the movie to use it for the sequel or something.Some people may argue that it was a little scary and/or suspenseful... I simply could not find anything scary about it. The scariest part for me was (tiny Spoiler Alert) the dog barking... - Unfortunately, I'm quite serious. Everything was quite predictable, most likely due to it's unoriginality. It was like every other exorcism movie out except with no ending.The only props I can give are to Fernanda Andrade (Isabella Rossi) and to Simon Quarterman (Ben) for a believable performance.All in all... Seriously people, don't waste your time and money on this.

This movie is so bad that it's insulting, and the thought of another human being actually enjoying it makes me want to vomit.It's almost as if everyone just gave up shortly after the pitch, and slept their entire way through filming. Actually, no. Because if they had been sleeping, they'd have an excuse.An abomination of this magnitude, however, is inexcusable.Also, it's chock-full of historical and cultural inaccuracies. Not that it makes a difference. The movie is horrible, regardless.In short? Giving this movie a 1 out of 10 is being very generous. Simply acknowledging it's existence is already too much.

Minor spoilers - won't spoil too much if you're still looking to watch, but they're there.I'm not sure what to say here, except that this movie was just bad. I'll try to explain why:Most of the parts that would be considered scary (but weren't at all really) are in the trailers. You can get the full experience (minus the disappointment of wasting your money) from the trailers, in my opinion.The only bit that had anyone scared in the cinema was a cheap jump scare when you're not expecting it - and guess what - it comes from a dog who's bark has been amplified to a volume level that would make anyone jump. This is lame and cheap to the point it's not even funny.It's flawed, if it follows demon lore that many other films follow. One of the demons, at one point, walks into a church dressed with robes and crosses, puts his hand in holy water and doesn't flinch. Now, there's multiple things wrong with this - first off demons are said not to be able to walk on holy ground (a church). He's dressed with a cross on, which supposedly repels the demons (and they're used as a weapon in the film - so what the hell was going on there I don't know), and demons are also repelled by holy water, which again is used as a weapon in this film.The ending. Dear god the ending. This film quite possibly has the worst and most abrupt ending I've seen in a movie. When things get interesting it cuts off, bringing up the credits and leaving you feeling massively ripped off.Please, if you consider yourself as a movie lover and respect yourself, do not go see this movie as you'll want to be in a shower for the next month to clean off the crap this film is.

reviews.review_title: Good beginning, good plot, horrible ending
reviews.content: One nice evening, in my normal life I had the comforting invitation of a friend of mine to watch a movie. After some long and tiresome minutes of arguing we finally decided to see this movie. After wasting approximately 25$ we went inside to enjoy the horror and suspense... The beginning felt good, it predicted a fine future for the movie; exorcisms, daemons, priests, horror, the kind of things we were looking forward too. However, this whole picture, turned upside down in the blink of an eye, when suddenly the movie ends in the middle of the climax of the plot. I will be completely sincere now, I raged. But I wasn't the only one, as the whole crowd of people made their own comments and noises of dissatisfaction. If you ask me, why this movie was a complete waste of time, is because of the ending. That movie, deserved a better ending, and it had all the likes of going into a better ending. Whomever feels this movie is great, I tolerate their opinion. I was expecting a good horror movie and got just that until the end, and even though many of you will disagree for me the ending can and in this case, did destroy the whole movie. I repeat, good plot until the horrible end. If you feel like watching it to enjoy the movie or get good a point of view to comment on my opinion, feel free. I felt I could have gotten a way better movie.

The first time I saw the trailer, I felt like the movie will fall under the genre of Paranormal Activity stuff. I was very impressed and insisted few of my friends and went to watch the movie on the release day itself. The introduction was pretty decent and I thought that the story has kicked off at the beginning itself. But I was completely wrong as this crap is not a movie. It is a complete documentary type and there is no scope of so called horror/suspense/thriller. All along the movie, the characters talk about exorcism which you don't feel at all. I spent 14$ to watch this movie and this is not even worth of a single dollar. It is better to watch the Ghost Hunters serial on the TV. You will be fooled and will be ripped off for sure.

Let me start out by saying that I was scared before the movie than after it. I fell asleep half way thru the movie, and my friend started playing around with his phone... This is how boring it is. It isn't really a movie, its more of a documentary, a fictional documentary that doesn't make sense. The Devil Inside shouldn't be shown in theaters but more like on The History Channel or something. I don't know why its rated R, My 4 year old cousin could probably watch this 'documentary' without being scared, he'll probably find it entertaining. The ending is just retarded. If I had $10 to waste, I wouldn't watch this movie again! I would throw the money away and not watch this piece of crap. The only scary part about the movie is when the dog jumps on the fence and starts barking.. I'm pretty sure this wasn't planned out as a scary part. That old lady/Mom was straight up hideous. Her roll didn't even fit her! The beginning 911 part leaves you with a "wtf" face. I gotta give this movie credit thought because it Mind-F***ed me.. It made me think that some parts are gonna be scary but actually aren't. I was closing my eyes expecting some scary stuff to come up but unfortunately, nothing. The animations weren't that great either. I bet my friends and I could make a more scarier movie than this.

I can't believe I wasted my time and money on this movie. If anyone deserves a paycheck for this flick, it's the promoters. Terrible, terrible, terrible. The only thing scary about this movie is the missing money from my wallet.Obviously I can't go into details, but if you venture out to the movies this weekend, avoid this title at all costs.There are way better movies out right now.Horrible Acting. Horrible video. Horrible story line. Horrible. If I were the makers of this movie, I would probably pray for a demon, or two, or three, to possess me.To be honest, you almost have to be possessed to go see this movie. I hate to be the one to ruin high hopes of a truly scary movie, but you'd be more afraid if you watched Jaws.

reviews.review_title: Go with a very very low expectations .. and you might enjoy it
reviews.content: I have bought my tickets already that night, and i was having a coffee before the show time when a facebook message came to my attention from a friend warning others NOT to see the movie .. That made me have a very very low expectations .. even though , this strategy did not work .. To cut the long story short, i slept for about 15 minutes in the movie, and i am a horror movie's addict .. my wife's friend freaked out , but she have seen in all her life two horror movies the scariest of which was big mama's house !!If you really have nothing to do .. this one might be little more fun than sitting in your car alone infront of your building Saturday night with no radio station's signal, and no lights around picking your nose !!!!

To say I was disappointed would be an understatement. I had no real ideas before going in to see this but had seen a few people on Facebook talking about it so thought I would give it a try.I was gutted from the off to find out it was yet another 'Documentary' style movie. It has been done too many times before and to offer this weak attempt was just embarrassing. My lack of interest in the characters was based upon how weak they were and at no point did I feel any of the acting made you think for a second that it could be anything but a run of the mill "horror" film.Of course there were one or two moments were you jumped but that was from a standard quiet scene then loud noise, the biggest jump was when a dog barked at a fence! I jumped out a cupboard once and scared my girlfriend worse than she was scared at this but I would never dream of charging about £8 for people to witness that.The ending was as if whoever made this film felt the same way as I did watching it and just said F*@* it, I give up, about an hour and a half later than they should have. I can't believe people are giving this an OK rating, the only reason it got a 1 from me was for the contortion during the demonic possession.This film may appeal to the kind of people that think Mrs Browns Boys is cutting edge comedy but I would suggest buying 800 penny sweets/8 x snacksters microwavable kebab double packs/ 80 packets of 10p crisps, whatever tickles your fancy just don't waste it on this.

reviews.review_title: Run, Don't Walk Away From Theater
reviews.content: If you're looking for a good scare at the movies, you would be better off seeing "The Devil Wears Prada".The film starts out completely promising and then degrades into a "Fallen"/"The Exorcist"/"Paranormal Activity 3" hybrid that does not seem ashamed of the fact that it is giving the audience the same of what we have all seen before and seen done far better.It is not shocking that this movie is loathed, but it is shocking that the audience that I saw it with seemed to like it. I guess that even people with bad taste are allowed in theaters.I would not recommend this film to any true horror fan.

OK I have read the reviews and I have to throw in my 2 cents. I too was looking forward to this movie. The previews got me. No you will not have nightmares but the reason why its not awful is because there was some good stuff in it. The murder scenes were very realistic. Kudos to the makeup peeps. Also I wasn't bored. I was OK with the story. I am not going to defend it like I thought it was the bomb BUT there are tons of others that were 100 times worse. Every Jason movie sucked so think back old schoolers. I do admit that they need to loose the hand held cameras but maybe its working. This movie made like 34 million in one weekend so the bad reviews really don't mean squat to the producers. Give it a chance but don't expect it to be like an original screening of The Exorcist.

reviews.review_title: i utterly hate this movie spoiler alert
reviews.content: before i even started watching this movie i knew it was full of crap lying to us with its documentary bull-crap being possessed by demons myself for over 20 years by multiple demons and trying to get deliverance over 45 times by Christians pastors etc god wont let me get delivered and i find your only reason for making this movie is greed to make money.. these fat elitist reviews.review_title: Went in to it with too high of expectations
reviews.content: **MAJOR SPOILERS** I love a good scary movie. The Exorcist being amongst my favorites. So when I heard this was an exorcist movie that featured an evil spirit jumping between souls without warning, I was all over it! Unfortunately, I was quite disappointed, and found myself laughing from humor, rather than jumping from fright.I'll give it that it is a very VISUAL movie, featuring contorted bodies, bloody corpses, and a guy shooting himself in the face flat out on camera in front of God and everybody (pun intended...)were enough to make me wince.The film starts out incredibly slow. Literally, NOTHING happens for at least 3/4 of this film. Once events did begin to occur, everything was predictable. I'd also like to add that I honestly believe if this WASN'T set up as a "found footage" documentary-style film, it may have done better. I got dizzy several times during the film and had to avert my eyes off the screen until I could balance myself again -- and at one point, I did miss a "scary" part because I wasn't looking at the screen.According to my Catholic movie-buddy, this movie is "creepy as ****" from a Catholic standing, which I can understand. Otherwise, it's quite a bit of a disappointment, and everyone involved with the movie could have done a MUCH better job...

Being a very large paranormal buff, I was eagerly anticipating watching this film, and it failed me completely. It was too predictable. From the dates being flashed at you to the contortion, which would be easy for most semi-flexible girls to be able to do, I felt let down. The story line dragged, as you were introduced to mundane characters whose back story you got so little of that you could hardly be interested in the possessed person's whispers of whatever the crime may have been (abortion, possibly a suicide and the attempt at murder). It's redeeming factor was that you simply wanted to know the demon's name, and even that never came to fruition. Sad, sad hour and a half that I won't be getting back.

What is up with fake documentaries? More importantly what is up with fake documentaries with shaky cameras missing their endings? 2 people walked out within the first 5 minutes and a few others left during the movie as well. (I wish I would have left) A shaky camera and a contortionist do not make a horror film. The commercials IMO are misleading. The scary blind nun plays no role in the movie, she is only a passer by on the street once. The crazy cuts and scary scenes you see in the commercial are basically the movie. There is nothing new in this film that hasn't been done multiple times. It's also only an hour and 20 minutes long. I don't know why they cut it short since it's lacking an ending and only sparks more confusion. The mother only has about 3 small cameos as well which is disappointing since she was the only true highlight to the movie. It has it's required shock/gore scenes but is lacking on story. It doesn't have the chill effect of Paranormal or a strong story/character development like The Others or Constantine. Knowing it's fake makes it seem like a badly told ghost story. No one in Dayton, Ohio at the 9 showing seemed to like it, we all left the theater talking about how it was a complete waste. I do not recommend this movie, wait for it to come to Red Box and rent it as a last resort.

reviews.review_title: No ending!!! Don't pay full price for 3/4 of a movie!!
reviews.content: That's right folks...the movie is your typical cheesy horror flick like all the rest of the exorcist movies made within the past 10 years.I actually don't mind cheesy horrors with their cheap scare tactics (typical "jump out at you" scares that make you jump in your seat), but what I can't accept is that this one left you without an ending at all.About what would typically be 3/4 the way through the movie, it just cuts out...movie done, move on suckers... no ending, no resolution, NOTHING! (except the credits of course) If you like these type of horror flicks, I won't judge (because I do too!), but I HIGHLY recommend saving your mula and waiting for it to come out on DVD. Don't pay full theatre price for only 3/4 of a movie - NOT WORTH IT! (Thank goodness I used a gift cert for this one, otherwise I may be a lot more bothered right now)

Want to believe I'm wrong and see it anyway hoping it's as good as the commercials promise? Then be my guest. But you'd be better off throwing your money out of a moving car. Or stay home, throw a brick through your TV and stare at that for two hours. It'll be more fun. I give it one star only because I can't use negative integers. Boring, unimaginative and grossly over rated. What bothers me is that it's making any money at all. Hollywood should be ashamed.

reviews.review_title: The Devil Inside- Scary, not thrilling. Funny, not hilarious
reviews.content: This movie is hard for me to decide whether it is good, reasonable, or just not what it could be. Seeing it alone I felt as though I was making a bad decision, that I would end up wishing that I would have brought a friend. But, with the couple horizontal in front of me as a side note, the movie didn't really scare me as I had thought it would have. Yes, it is completed with scenes that surely have the ability to make you jump, the movie really isn't scary as it's more interesting than horrifying. Exorcisms are a dirty, difficult act as proved by this movie. The equipment, number of people, and the location are all things that all need to be considered in depth. Especially for a person who knows nothing about the work, as in Isabella Rossi whose mother killed three people while an exorcism was being performed on her. Her mother Maria is kept in an institution in Italy to keep her under control from what is suspected of her. As the hospital workers think it is merely insanity, the truth is, Maria is somehow possessed by a demon, and has been for years before. As she explains in the beginning, Isabella has always known something was seriously wrong with her troubled mother but she never exactly understood it until she found out her mother and the three murders, especially becoming concerned after learning that an exorcism was being performed upon her. Any regular person would freak at finding something out about their mother such as this, but Isabella treats it as though it's cancer her mothers going through, not insanity from possession by a demon. Demons in the world is an ongoing topic in the world, yet those who actually do believe in them merely think of them as harmless, not at all raging, killing machines. But aside from all this, the movie (in documentary form) goes on to tell the story of trying to help the mother escape the grasp of this so called demon. Experiencing an exorcism is first up for Maria to prepare to begin helping her mother. Crazy yet on-spot, the first exorcism goes on and on, not really having an outcome of any kind. But not long after this event, as it seems in the movie anyhow, they go to the hospital to try and perform an actual exorcism on Maria. But being against the law for the exorcists to perform such an exorcism, the stakes are high and the two exorcists don't really know what to expect after they finish it. Finding out the true death of the three victims in the first attempt to perform the exorcism is when things really begin to get risky as they find out that they died by the demon within Maria, but not physically. In the end, the violent end that is, it becomes hard to decide whether it was actually a good movie at all, but after a couple days of seeing the movie I've decided that the movie is fairly good, but again, more interesting than scary or even entertaining.
